subject: linear_algebra
title: Spectral Theorem for Symmetric Matrices
contentHtml: The Spectral Theorem states that every symmetric matrix can be orthogonally diagonalized.

theorem.statement: \[ \text{If } A \in \mathbb{R}^{n\times n} \text{ is symmetric, then there exists an orthogonal matrix } Q \in \mathbb{R}^{n\times n} \text{ and a diagonal matrix } \Lambda \in \mathbb{R}^{n\times n} \text{ such that } A = Q \Lambda Q^T. \]
theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the eigenvectors of a symmetric matrix are orthogonal, and then using this fact to construct an orthogonal matrix that diagonalizes the original matrix.

intuition: This theorem is crucial in linear algebra because it allows us to easily diagonalize symmetric matrices, which is essential for many applications in machine learning and data analysis.
realWorldApplications: Eigenvalue decomposition is used in many ML/AI algorithms, such as PCA, LDA, and k-means clustering.
